title: Oscars 2017: Iranian nominee wins after BOYCOTTING awards over Trump immigration ban
text:
Oscars 2017: Iranian nominee wins after BOYCOTTING awards over Trump immigration ban Oscars 2017: Iranian nominee wins after BOYCOTTING awards over Trump immigration ban IRANIAN OSCAR Nominee Asghar Farhadi won an Academy Award after boycotting the ceremony over President Trump’s immigration ban. PUBLISHED: 03:29, Mon, Feb 27, 2017 | UPDATED: 03:39, Mon, Feb 27, 2017 
The Muslim filmmaker directed The Salesman, which won Best Foreign Language Film at the Oscars . 
Anousheh Ansari, who presented the award, read out Farhadi’s statement from abroad, which referenced President Trump’s immigration ban for seven majority Muslim countries. 
It said: “It's a great honour to be receiving this valuable award for the second time. 
“I’m sorry I'm not with you tonight, my absence is out of respect for the people of my country and those of the other six countries who have been disrespected by the inhumane law that bans immigrants from seven countries to the US.” Related articles
